trial_identification.studytitle: Evaluation of intraocular pressure changes during anesthesia
trial_identification.scientifictitle: "Intraocular pressure changes during sevoflurane and desflurane anesthesia in patients requiring non-ophthalmic surgery: randomised, controlled trial"

conditions.healthcondition: ASA 1-2, patients scheduled for general anesthesia in non-ophtalmic surgery in supine position

interventions.interventions: Desflurane is the intervention of the study. It is very frequently used inhalant anesthetic. It will be inhaled approxiamately 1 hour for the duration of the surgical procedure at 1 Minimum alveolar concentration (MAC) .
interventions.comparator: Sevoflurane is the control treatment. Itis an inhalant anesthetic.It will be inhaled approxiamately 1 hour for the duration of the surgical procedure at 1 Minimum alveolar concentration (MAC) .

primaryOutcome.outcome: Evaluation of intraocular pressure changes with sevoflurane and desflurane with perkins tonometer.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Before operation begins, after induction, after intubation, during the surgery at every 15 minutes. after the extubation.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: any eye problems after surgery (If patient complaint any eye problems such as pain or changes in seeing; ophtalmology consultation will be done)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 24 hours after completion of the surgery

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Without any eye disorder, not using eye medications, ASA 1-2, scheduled for non-ophtalmic surgery general anesthesia. Mallampathy score less than 3.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: DM, HT, Cardiovascular problems,known eye disorders or using some eye medicatons,refusal of the study, immunulugic disease, rheumatologic disease history, laparoscopic procedures, hard to ventilate and intubate, succinylcholine use during induction of anesthesia

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Meram Medical School Anesthesiology DPT, Akyokus Street, Meram 42080 KONYA

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Meram Medical School Anesthesiology DPT, Akyokus Street, Meram 42080 KONYA

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Meram Medical School Anesthesiology DPT, Akyokus Street, Meram 42080 KONYA

ethicsAndSummary.summary: American Society of Anesthesiologists Classification (ASA) 1-2 patients scheduled for non-ophtalmic surgery under general anesthesia included to the study. Patients are allocated in one of the groups either sevoflurane or desflurane. Intraocular pressure changes measured with perkin's tonometer before surgery, after induction, after intubation at every 15 min during the surgery, after extubation.
